{"step_by_step_thinking": "Piperacillin is a ureidopenicillin, which is a type of penicillin, so option C is true. It is active against pseudomonas aeruginosa, so option A is also true. Piperacillin is given parenterally, so option D is true. However, piperacillin does not inhibit beta-lactamase. It is often combined with tazobactam, a beta-lactamase inhibitor, to increase its effectiveness.", "answer_choice": "B"}
